flawed_nl_solution:
His utilities cost 1/2 the amount of his $250 car payment so his utilities cost 250/2 = $<<250/2=125>>125
All total, his bills cost him 775+250+125+50 = $<<775+250+125+50=1200>>1200
He makes $2500 a month and his bills cost $1200 a month so that leaves him with 2500-1200 = $<<2500-1200=1296>>1296
He wants to put half of $1296 into a retirement account so he will invest 1296/2= $<<1296/2=648>>648 into his retirement account
He had 1296 and puts $648 into his retirement account so that leaves him with 1296-648 = $<<1296-648=648>>648 remaining
#### 648

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1300, not 1296. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
